full_text: Des Srey aes 1 Rar 2016/KER/72 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE B.KEMAL PASHA MONDAY, THE 4TH DAY OF JANUARY 2016/14TH POUSHA, 1937 Cri.MC.No. 8076 of 2015 CC 585/2015 OF JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT-II, ERNAKULAM CRIME NO. 1600/2012 OF CHERANELLOOR POLICE STATION, ERNAKULAM PETITIONER: JAISE N. THOMAS, AGED 45 YEARS, S/O LATE THOMMY, NELLICKAL HOSUE, ELOOKKARA, MUPPATHADOM P.O., ALUVA-683110. BY ADV. SMT.NISHA JOHN RESPONDENTS: 1. STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM-682031. 2. S.I. OF POLICE, CHERANELLOOR POLICE STATION-682035. BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SMT.SAREENA THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 04-01-2016, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: PJ Des Sebastes Eee 2016/KER/72 Cri.MC.No. 8076 of 2015 APPENDIX PETITIONER(S)' ANNEXURES ANNEXURE A1: TRUE COPY OF F.I.R. NO.1600/12 DATED 16.12.2012. ANNEXURE A2: TRUE COPY OF THE JUDGEMENT DATED 6.1.2015 IN WPC NO.16414/14. ANNEXURE A3: TRUE COPY OF THE COMPLAINT FILED BY PETITIONER' MOTHER DATED 9.9.2015 BEFORE CIRCLE INSPECTOR OF POLICE, BINANIPURAM. ANNEXURE A4: TRUE COPY OF THE ACKNOWLEDGEMENT RECEIPT PETITIONER ISSUED FROM THE DISTRICT POLICE OFFICE, ERNAKULAM RURAL. ANNEXURE AS5: CERTIFIED COPY OF THE CHARGE SHEET NPO.13/13 FILED BY S.I. OF POLICE, CHERANELLOOR POLICE STATION IN JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT, II-ERNAKULAM. RESPONDENT(S)' ANNEXURES NIL. | TRUE COPY / P.S. TO JUDGE PJ Bip 2016/KER/72 B. KEMAL PASHA, J. Dated this the 4" day of January, 2016 ORDER Heard learned counsel for the petitioner and learned Public Prosecutor. 2. According to the petitioner, the de _ facto complainant in CC No.585/2015 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-ll, Ernakulam is a habitual offender and a known criminal. It is the case of the petitioner that the case against him is falsely foisted deliberately by the de facto complainant. On going through the records and on hearing the learned counsel for the petitioner, this Court is of the view that the present arguments forwarded by the learned counsel for the petitioner are arguments that can be raised before the court below at the stage of Section 239 Cr.PC. This Court cannot go into the intrinsic particulars of the evidence collected by the investigating officer and weigh the Ll Sebastes ap 2016/KER/72 Crl.M.C.8076/2015 :2: evidence on merits. With liberty to the petitioner to approach the court below under Section 239 Cr.PC., this Crl.M.C. is disposed of. In case of such an application, the court below shall consider it on merits and pass appropriate orders in accordance with law. Sd/- (B.KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE) aks/04/01 // True Copy // PA to Judge
